meanings.definition: Occurring in an abnormal position or place.
meanings.sent1: The ectopic plant grew sideways instead of upwards.
meanings.sent2: The doctor found an ectopic tooth growing in the wrong spot.
meanings.sent3: It was quite funny to see the ectopic chair placed on the ceiling.
meanings.sent4: Her sense of humor was ectopic, always catching people off guard.
meanings.sent5: The ectopic road sign led drivers in circles, causing confusion.

meanings.definition: Located in an abnormal position in the body.
meanings.sent1: The ectopic kidney was causing discomfort for the patient.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon successfully removed the ectopic appendix.
meanings.sent3: The ectopic heart seemed to beat to its own rhythm.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like ectopic butterflies, fluttering unpredictably.
meanings.sent5: The ectopic bone growth protruded oddly, requiring medical attention.
